item.title: Planning Gift Deliveries With QGIS
item.description: In this post, I document my journey of using QGIS, a free and open-source geographic information system, to plan gift deliveries. I outline the steps to install QGIS, add essential plugins, create a shapefile layer for mapping locations, and use ORS Tools for route planning. After configuring the map, I determined that my delivery route would take 3 hours. This process, while tailored to my use case, is versatile and applicable to various fields such as logistics, urban planning, and environmental management. QGIS provides robust tools for efficient spatial analysis and mapping tasks.
